# CI/CD Pipeline Setup Complete
I've successfully created a comprehensive CI/CD pipeline for your Spring Boot customer service application using GitHub Actions and AWS CodeBuild. The setup includes automated testing, building, containerization, and deployment to both staging and production environments.
## Files Created
- [ci-cd.yml](.github/workflows/ci-cd.yml) - GitHub Actions workflow for CI/CD pipeline - [buildspec.yml](buildspec.yml) - Main CodeBuild configuration for building and testing - [buildspec-staging.yml](buildspec-staging.yml) - CodeBuild configuration for staging deployment - [buildspec-production.yml](buildspec-production.yml) - CodeBuild configuration for production deployment - [README-CICD.md](README-CICD.md) - Comprehensive documentation and setup guide
## Pipeline Architecture
```plantuml @startuml !theme plain
package "GitHub Repository" { [Source Code] [Pull Request] }
package "GitHub Actions" { [Test Job] [Build Job] [Docker Build Job] [Deploy Staging] [Deploy Production] }
package "AWS Services" { [Amazon ECR] [CodeBuild Staging] [CodeBuild Production] [ECS Staging] [ECS Production] }
[Source Code] --> [Test Job] : Push/PR [Test Job] --> [Build Job] : Tests Pass [Build Job] --> [Docker Build Job] : Build Success [Docker Build Job] --> [Amazon ECR] : Push Image [Deploy Staging] --> [CodeBuild Staging] : Trigger [Deploy Production] --> [CodeBuild Production] : Trigger [CodeBuild Staging] --> [ECS Staging] : Deploy [CodeBuild Production] --> [ECS Production] : Deploy
@enduml ```
## Key Features
### GitHub Actions Workflow - **Automated Testing**: Runs unit tests on every push and pull request - **Build Automation**: Compiles and packages Spring Boot application - **Container Registry**: Builds Docker images and pushes to Amazon ECR - **Environment Deployment**: Separate workflows for staging and production - **Artifact Management**: Caches Maven dependencies and uploads build artifacts
### AWS CodeBuild Integration - **Main Build Project**: Handles compilation, testing, and Docker image creation - **Staging Deployment**: Automated deployment with health checks - **Production Deployment**: Blue-green deployment strategy with rollback capabilities - **Security Scanning**: Optional container and code security analysis
### Deployment Strategy - **Staging**: Automatic deployment from `develop` branch - **Production**: Automatic deployment from `main` branch with enhanced safety checks - **Health Monitoring**: Comprehensive health checks and automatic rollback - **Zero Downtime**: Blue-green deployment for production releases
## ⚙️ Configuration Requirements
### GitHub Secrets Add these secrets to your GitHub repository: ``` AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID # AWS access key for ECR and CodeBuild AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY # AWS secret access key ```
### AWS Infrastructure Setup 1. **ECR Repository**: Create `customer-service` repository 2. **ECS Clusters**: Set up staging and production clusters 3. **CodeBuild Projects**: Create three projects for build and deployments 4. **IAM Roles**: Configure service roles with appropriate permissions
### Environment Variables Update in buildspec files: - `AWS_ACCOUNT_ID`: Your AWS account ID (currently set to `123456789012`) - `ECR_REPOSITORY`: ECR repository name - `ECS_CLUSTER_NAME`: ECS cluster names for staging/production - `ECS_SERVICE_NAME`: ECS service names
## Security Features
- **Least Privilege IAM**: Minimal required permissions for each component - **Secrets Management**: AWS Secrets Manager integration for sensitive data - **Parameter Store**: Environment-specific configuration management - **Container Scanning**: Optional security scanning in build pipeline - **Audit Logging**: CloudTrail integration for deployment tracking
## Deployment Workflow
1. **Development**: Create feature branch and push changes 2. **Testing**: GitHub Actions automatically runs tests on PR 3. **Staging**: Merge to `develop` branch triggers staging deployment 4. **Production**: Merge to `main` branch triggers production deployment 5. **Monitoring**: Health checks ensure successful deployments
## Documentation
The `README-CICD.md` file provides: - Complete setup instructions - AWS infrastructure requirements - Troubleshooting guide - Security best practices - Manual deployment procedures
## Next Steps
1. Replace placeholder AWS Account ID in buildspec files 2. Create required AWS infrastructure (ECR, ECS, CodeBuild) 3. Configure GitHub repository secrets 4. Set up Parameter Store and Secrets Manager values 5. Test the pipeline with a sample deployment
The pipeline is now ready for use and follows enterprise-grade CI/CD best practices with proper testing, security, and deployment strategies.
